comment: One phenomenon I've seen is that when there's an issue, if you have made yourself the most dependable, that 1st phone call when there's a issue will ALWAYS go to you. xD
Sad, because the slackers in that situation win yet AGAIN!
I find that the main problem with retail is that they want to schedule as few people as possible
I mean, I get it, labor is the easiest cost you can control
But at the same time, if someone doesn't show or quits, and you're already running at the bare minimum, it's gonna become a giant circus trying to get your bases covered
When companies could EASILY rectify this and make the work environment more relaxed by having a buffer of an employee or two
I wonder if there'll ever be anything at work that's breaks the last straw
People Who Fix Computers, What's The Worst Thing You Found? (r/AskReddit)
New Patreon Post: Good Morning Kathrin https://www.patreon.com/posts/good-morning-33974634
ive been very stressed lately, and i guess ive been drinking too much coffee
also, lots of future work stuff coming up and im stressed about that
I'm trying to do too much at once in my spare time...
Between books, video games, drawing, listening to music and watching music, i feel paralyzed.
I feel like I have to do it all.
I have the oposite problem.  I have all these things I want to do, but I feel like I can't.
ive also been doing that lately. burning the candle in both ends. usually ends with a crash.
usually this happens to me in the winter months also.
in summer im better at balancing work/home projects and just having fun
Well, for me, it's been a problem for a few years.
I feel like I have to do everything at once, and then I do nothing
I feel like it all has to happen "Now"
i know that feeling, its paralyzing
never going for a more sustainable move.
It's kinda like corporations and profits to be honest
On top of that, today I'm trying to prevent myself from having a bad habit relapse. It's very tough.
i cant say i have any advice but the first step is to acknowledge it
Well, I managed to do that so far..
The problem I always have is even when I recognize it and what I need to do to prevent it, I take the path of least resistance and relapse anyway. So I have to watch for that too.
if taking all measures is too hard, try to do 1
if the problem is that youre doing too many things, try to do 1 thing less.
this reminds me of the little book of calm scene in black books
how manny is stressed out in his accountant job
and reads the little book of calm, but it doesnt help him
Everytime something's supposed to work, it musn't for the sake of comedy
i was surprised the little book of calm is an actual thing and not something they just made up
you can buy it on amazon
“Jesus paid for our sins, so let's get our money's worth.”
I don't think we need to go THAT far XD
yeah, not very insightful. i dont know if its supposed to be a series of jokes, or if its trying to be insightful
but its funny in black books
Manny ends up eating the book somehow and becomes completely zen
come to think of it... Zen in TK is quite zen :ctwokinds-floraquestion:
i think he almost choked to death and went to hospital
but he rises again, in the hospital gown and looks like jesus
"And the Lord spake unto us, and he did say..."
I need some sleep...I'm going to say goodnight.
I was right, my feet got used to the 3 day work week with days off between work xD
They hurt slightly today, tomorrow gonna be fuuuuuun
I should mention this is the same place that seems to love having technical issues
And apparently some of the issues might be fixable- if the company was willing to pony up, lol
And so, I'm making an exception to my 3-day work availability for him :P
(it's not that I refuse to work more than 4 days a week, I just don't want to be consistently scheduled above 3, but I'll cover the occasional shift)
I finally finished my goku ultra instinct drawing
